SEARCH
Package hms.boundary.administrator.ManageStaff

Class AddStaffView

java.lang.Object
hms.boundary.View
hms.boundary.administrator.ManageStaff.AddStaffView
public class AddStaffView extends hms.boundary.View
The view class for adding new staff members (Doctor, Pharmacist, Receptionist) in the system. This class provides prompts for the user to input details for each role and displays success or error messages.

  • Constructor Details

    • AddStaffView

      public AddStaffView()

  • Method Details

    • getRoleChoice

      public int getRoleChoice()
      Prompts the administrator to choose the role of the staff member to be added.
      Returns:
      The selected role choice as an integer (1 for Doctor, 2 for Pharmacist, 3 for Receptionist, 4 for Cancel).

    • getDetails

      public List<String> getDetails() throws hms.exceptions.InvalidChoiceFormatException, hms.exceptions.InvalidChoiceValueException
      Prompts the administrator to enter the details (ID, Name, Gender) for the new staff member.
      Returns:
      A list containing the ID, Name, and Gender ("M" for Male, "F" for Female) of the staff member.
      Throws:
      hms.exceptions.InvalidChoiceFormatException - If the input format is invalid.
      hms.exceptions.InvalidChoiceValueException - If the input value is invalid.

    • getAge

      public int getAge()
      Prompts the administrator to enter the age of the staff member.
      Returns:
      The entered age if valid, or -1 if the input is invalid.

    • addDoctorSuccessful

      public void addDoctorSuccessful()
      Displays a message confirming that a Doctor has been successfully added.

    • addPharmacistSuccessful

      public void addPharmacistSuccessful()
      Displays a message confirming that a Pharmacist has been successfully added.

    • addReceptionistSuccessful

      public void addReceptionistSuccessful()
      Displays a message confirming that a Receptionist has been successfully added.

    • userExists

      public void userExists()
      Displays a message indicating that the user already exists in the system.
